result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl B Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and to commence within 60 days.

Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Dave at GLSO.
Amended Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Amended Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
from Clerk to Defendant re: Payment Arrangements
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

1:08 p.m  Defendant appears in court.
Defendant states he just started working.  Requests to set up payment plan.
Court orders warrabt - stayed.  Defendant to pay $25 every other week starting Dec. 4, 2015.
Court adjourned 1:10 p.m.
FTP Hearing 11-16-2015 for $543.00

11:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement - will plea to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Corut orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

60 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days
Court costs - court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 11:59 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-18-2015 11:00 am

2:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and defendant requests time to think about the offer.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on August 18, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:11 p.m.
Status hearing at 07-13-2015 02:00 pm

3:Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Violent Contact with Samantha N.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 6, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
